class_notes:
This course explores art from ancient Egypt in the period from the beginning of the New Kingdom to the conquest of Egypt by Rome (1550-30 BCE). Structured roughly chronologically, the course explores the uses and developments of ancient Egyptian works of art and architecture within their social, religious, and political contexts as indicated by contemporary sources and traces of practice attested archaeologically. The course includes opportunities to study works from the period at the Michael C. Carlos Museum.
Art History major/minor: Division I
course_description: An introduction to the art of ancient Egypt from the beginning of the New Kingdom to the conquest of Egypt by Rome.
